items.content_html:
Summary

This PR adds browser compat data for AudioContext.setSinkId() and friends.

See my research document for more details on exactly what the changes are.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Add setSinkId data

items.content_html:
FF109 adds support for new <system-color> values Mark, MarkText, ButtonBorder in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1638052

There is no support in Chrome according to https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260079.

There is no evident of support in Safari et al.

Other docs work for this can be tracked in mdn/content#23334
items.title: FF109: CSS system-color add Mark, MarkText, ButtonBorder

items.content_html:
Summary

Fix up the version_added field for a couple properties

Test results and supporting details

https://web.archive.org/web/20150609090643/https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/tabs#method-getZoomSettings
https://web.archive.org/web/20150609090643/https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/tabs#type-ZoomSettings

Related issues

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1772166
items.title: Add Chrome version numbers for tabs webextensions API

items.content_html:
Removed mention of background-attachment: local bug

Summary

I've removed the mention of background-attachment: local not working on iOS. According to the bug report it has been fixed and merged. However I'm not exactly sure in which Safari version.

Test results and supporting details

I've tested this on an iPhone 12 Pro iOS16.2 and using BrowserStack iPhone 12 Pro iOS14.
Using these examples:
https://codepen.io/smashingmag/pen/ExRNxpd
https://codepen.io/bramus/pen/ExxgNrV

Related

This is another bug that has been fixed by the same fix.
items.title: Update background-attachment.json

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR updates compat data associated with the Payment Handler API. Ther are a few weird things going on here; you can read my research document to find out the full story.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues
items.title: Update Payment Handler API data

Summary

Firefox 109 added support for CSS mod() function.

Ref: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1785117

items.content_html:
The chrome version has been updated in https://chromestatus.com/feature/5090980649238528. This PR reflects those changes.

@queengooborg Please review.
items.title: Update chrome version for media session slides actions

items.content_html:
Summary

I have run test on Chrome, Firefox, and Safari. Only firefox has this feature working.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Chromium issue
Webkit issue
items.title: Remove support for video-dynamic-range

items.content_html:
Adding the declarativeNetRequest API.

Complement the content addition in #22644

  • core content
  • confirm core content release versions
  • add detail for additions and deprecations
items.title: Add declarativeNetRequest

items.content_html:
Summary

Add support for start and end on align-items for Safari 16.

Test results and supporting details

Navigate to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items in Chrome (107.0.5304.110) and Safari (16). Visually compare behavior of Results section.

Compared values:

  • normal
  • flex-start
  • flex-end
  • start
  • end

Screenshot of Safari 16 with one of the aforementioned values:

As for existing bug reports, I didn't find anything specific to align-items -- I will admit I am not acquainted with searching for bugs in webkit. A a comment in a similar report mentions that many flexbox bugs were fixed by Feb 2022.

Related issues
items.title: Safari supports `start` and `end`

items.content_html:
Summary

overflow-wrap: anywhere is now supported in Safari (https://twitter.com/jensimmons/status/1515042940783104002). It should be from Safari 15.4 according to #17012 (comment).

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #17012
items.title: Add Safari support for `overflow-wrap: anywhere`

items.content_html:
Summary

These changes were generated procedurally by the mdn-bcd-collector project [1] using data collected from Chrome for Android [2].

[1] https://github.com/foolip/mdn-bcd-collector
commit 06ea2714451c548934849011e4106b3175adfab5
[2] https://github.com/foolip/mdn-bcd-results
commit f37e6db1da24143bf039ed8e269c9f234d2b4e90

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

This changeset is based on the one originally submitted via #17908. It uses compatibility data which has been collected since that patch was created, and it includes only a subset of the changes generated by the mdn-bcd-collector.
items.title: Update support data for Chrome Android (API's T through Z)

items.content_html:
Summary

The keepalive parameter to the Fetch (and Request) API is still not supported by Firefox and this is likely to catch people out.

This PR grabs the fetch param data from the Request API to make this clearer (located in api/Request.json).

Test results and supporting details

Symlinked build dir into mdn/content and checked build.

Related issues
items.title: Add fetch keepalive compat data

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing slotchange_event member of the ShadowRoot API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v7.0.0).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/ShadowRoot/slotchange_event

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Add missing api.ShadowRoot.slotchange_event feature

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing [dis]connect_event member of the Serial API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v7.0.0).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/Serial/[dis]connect_event

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Add missing api.Serial.[dis]connect_event feature

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing activationStart member of the PerformanceNavigationTiming API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v7.0.0).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/PerformanceNavigationTiming/activationStart

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Add missing api.PerformanceNavigationTiming.activationStart feature
